title: Madhubani Painting
short_description: Intricate geometrical patterns and mythological themes painted with natural dyes/pigments, originating from Bihar.
long_description:
Madhubani art (or Mithila painting) is practiced in the Mithila region of Bihar and Nepal. Traditionally done by women on freshly plastered mud walls of their homes, it has now moved to canvas and paper. 

The paintings are characterized by eye-catching geometrical patterns. There are no gaps left in the painting; the empty spaces are filled with flowers, animals, birds, and geometric designs. The themes mostly revolve around Hindu deities like Krishna, Ram, Shiva, and Durga, and natural objects like the sun and moon.
traditional_methods: Filling colors using twigs or fingers.

major_centres.title: Madhubani / Jitwarpur
major_centres.summary: The villages of Jitwarpur and Ranti are famous for their master artists.

shipping_and_packaging_tips: Paintings can be rolled. Easy to carry.
authenticity_tips: Look for the tiny double lines and hatching (Kachni) work.
local_economy_note: A major source of women's empowerment in the region.
seo_title: Madhubani Painting Guide: Mithila Folk Art
seo_description: Explore Madhubani art from Bihar. Intricate folk paintings of mythology and nature using natural dyes.
